item.title: Comment on Video: State of Comms Sites & UI Customization in SP Online by Guy Lee
item.dc:creator: Guy Lee
item.description: Excellent video/session Randy. It really helped me in understanding which knobs we can turn with branding SharePoint Online. Looks like I'll need to spend some time getting comfortable with SPFx Extensions.
item.content:encoded: Excellent video/session Randy. It really helped me in understanding which knobs we can turn with branding SharePoint Online. Looks like I’ll need to spend some time getting comfortable with SPFx Extensions.

item.title: Comment on Design Manager Bug – SharePoint 2013 RTM by Onedram

item.description: Great, it works! You saved a lot of my time, thank you!
item.content:encoded: Great, it works! You saved a lot of my time, thank you!

item.title: Comment on SharePoint Designer wrongfully says a file is checked out when it is not by Emmy Eastwood
item.dc:creator: Emmy Eastwood
item.description: I actually went to the document's properties and clicked on Remove Properties and Personal Information. That seems to have worked. But I am not an expert.
item.content:encoded: I actually went to the document’s properties and clicked on Remove Properties and Personal Information. That seems to have worked. But I am not an expert.

item.content:encoded:

item.title: Comment on Design Manager Bug – SharePoint 2013 RTM by Vipul Jain
item.dc:creator: Vipul Jain
item.description: Adding "DeltaPlaceHolderPageTitleInTitleArea" in custom master page solved the issue.
item.content:encoded: Adding “DeltaPlaceHolderPageTitleInTitleArea” in custom master page solved the issue.

item.title: Comment on SP2010 Branding Tip #2 – Custom Master Pages and Dialog Boxes by webwmn
item.dc:creator: webwmn
item.description:
I used a width of 60% and it worked and also used .ms-dialog #s4-v4body also allowed me to remove the background image and go with white. Resolved.
thanks
item.content:encoded:
I used a width of 60% and it worked and also used .ms-dialog #s4-v4body also allowed me to remove the background image and go with white. Resolved.

thanks

item.title: Comment on SP2010 Branding Tip #2 – Custom Master Pages and Dialog Boxes by webwmn
item.dc:creator: webwmn
item.content:encoded:
How does this work in a V4 master that is mostly customized by an attached CSS file?

I used a V4 master to create a system master customized by css. The modal window is now very wide. When I used “s4-notdlg” in the body container, the site went to full width and the scroll bar didn’t work. I tried using your modal script here but it didn’t work.

.ms-dialog #s4-bodyContainer {
margin:0px !important;
width:auto !important;
height:auto !important;
padding: 0px !important;
}
